sn35.231:1.1: About a dozen discourses refer to a “monk or nun”. It is probable that when discourses were taught, there would have normally been nuns present, just as there were random lay people listening in (SN 35.241:7.1).
sn35.231:4.1: It is tempting to translate khīra (“milk”) here as “sap”, but the milky liquid exuded by these trees is a distinct substance called latex.
